Access Name.Description: To identify a part by using a unique access name.
Access Name.Name: Access Name

Add/Replace/Delete.Description: The ADD/Delete/Replace modifiers are used in a definition to Add/Delete/Replace an attribute to the Definition.
Add/Replace/Delete.Name: Add/Replace/Delete

Background.Description: This attribute sets the background color for the part.
Background.Name: Background

Balance.Description: This attribute help to decide balance method of value, it will take parameter like daily ($Date), Weekly etc., based on that it will inserted total line and opening line, but a form can contain multiple parts.. so at the part level balancing decides, whether the balancing attributes given at the form level will get applied for this part or not

Meta.Aliases: Balance, Balancing, Closing Bal, Closing Balance

Balance.Name: Balance

Border.Description: Describes the type of Border to be used for the specific Part.
Border.Name: Border

Bottom Line.Description: It is used to place the lines at the bottom of the Part with respect to the Height specified within the Part Definition.
Bottom Line.Name: Bottom Line

Bottom Part.Description: It occupies the Bottom Section of the Part.

Meta.Aliases: Bottom Part, Bottom Parts, Right Part, Right Parts

Bottom Part.Name: Bottom Part

Break.Description: This attribute is usually associated with the attribute Repeat in the alter mode of the form.  The repetition of the line belonging to the collection is stopped when the condition specified in the attribute Break After is satisfied.
Break.Name: Break

Break On.Description: This attribute is usually associated with the attribute Repeat in the alter mode of the form.  The repetition of the line belonging to the collection is stopped when the condition specified in the attribute Break On is satisfied.
Break On.Name: Break On

Button.Description: This attribute specifies the buttons inside the part definition.

Meta.Aliases: Button, Buttons, Top Button, Top Buttons

Button.Name: Button

Cell Write.Description: Specifies whether the data should be written to the excel sheet cell by cell or as a whole.
Cell Write.Name: Cell Write

Combine.Description: The values of this attribute can only be the field names defined in the part.  The total or subtotal of field / fields can be accessed anywhere in the part using the functions $$Total and $$SubTotal respectively.
Combine.Name: Combine

Common Border.Description: Allocates common border for the Part ei, decides if the borders specified for one line should be extended for entire part as such. To stop the extension of the border towards up, subtitle : Yes can be given the required fields.
Common Border.Name: Common Border

Default Line.Description: It is used to highlight the appropriate line which satisfies the given condition. All the methods of the object associated with the line, can be used while specifying the condition.
Default Line.Name: Default Line

Digital Sign.Description: This attribute specifies whether the digital signature is displayed in the part or not.
Digital Sign.Name: Digital Sign

Display X Axis Legend.Description: This attribute is used to display the x-axis legend. Its default value is set to FALSE.
Display X Axis Legend.Name: Display X Axis Legend

DMPMode.Description: This is available in Form, Part, Line, Field and it is used only in dot matrix mode of printing to set the style.
DMPMode.Name: DMPMode

Enable Graph Cursor.Description: This attribute is used to specify whether cursor movements should be enabled for the graph or not.
Enable Graph Cursor.Name: Enable Graph Cursor

Excel AutoFit.Description: This is useful during Excel Export. If this is set to 'Yes',   the field values will automatically fit in the cell during Excel Export.
Excel AutoFit.Name: Excel AutoFit

Excel Sheet Name.Description: Specify the name of Sheet in Excel on which data needs to be exported.
Excel Sheet Name.Name: Excel Sheet Name

Fixed.Description: This attribute helps to skip the part in alteration mode.
Fixed.Name: Fixed

Float.Description: This is a logical attribute. If the value is set to Yes, then the bottom lines will appear immediately after completing the scrolled lines. If this is specified as No, then the bottom lines will always appear at the bottom of the part
Float.Name: Float

Graph Display Cursor Label.Description: This attribute is used to display a label with the value associated with the data point the cursor is focused on in the graph. This attribute is evaluated only if 'Enable graph cursor' is also set to TRUE.
Graph Display Cursor Label.Name: Graph Display Cursor Label

Graph Display Num Rows.Description: This attribute is used to specify the maximum number of rows displayed in a graph. When this threshold is exceeded, horizontal scrolling is enabled. This attribute is evaluated only if 'Enable graph cursor' is set to TRUE.
Graph Display Num Rows.Name: Graph Display Num Rows

Graph Style.Description: This attribute is used to configure the graph's style, such as choosing between a Bar graph or a Line graph.
Graph Style.Name: Graph Style

Graph Type.Description: This attribute is used to draw the graph. If this attribute is made Yes then Bar graph is displayed. To get 'X' and 'Y' axis, the part should contain 2 fields each specifying Graph Label : Yes/No.
Graph Type.Name: Graph Type

Height.Description: Helps to set the height to a Part. If height is not specified for a part, it will take depending upon the number of line within it.
Height.Name: Height

Help.Description: This helps to get the help of the area depending upon the context we are in. Specifies the index / id of the help file.
Help.Name: Help

Horizontal Align.Description: This attribute specifies the horizontal alignment of the part.

Parameters.Keywords: Bottom, Center, Centre, Justified, Left, Prompt, Right, Top

Horizontal Align.Name: Horizontal Align

Image.Description: This attribute is used to draw the image from the specified resource.
Image.Name: Image

Invisible.Description: This attribute decides the visibility of the part. If the Part is made Invisible, then the Part will occupy no space.
Invisible.Name: Invisible

JSONTag.Description: To specify the tag name for the part in the exported JSON/XML file. If not specified, the tag name for the part doesn't appear in the output.
JSONTag.Name: JSONTag

Left Part.Description: It occupies the Top Section of the Part.

Meta.Aliases: Left Part, Left Parts, Part, Parts, Top Part, Top Parts

Left Part.Name: Left Part

Line.Description: It is used to place lines at the top.

Meta.Aliases: Line, Lines, Top Line, Top Lines

Line.Name: Line

Local.Description: The Local attribute is used in the context of the definition to set local value within the scope of that definition only.
Local.Name: Local

Local Formula.Description: This is used to specify a local formula within the Part.
Local Formula.Name: Local Formula

Number Of Display Lines In Scroll.Description: This attribute is utilized only when vertical scrolling is enabled within the part and when both the containing form and part have no specified height, and the containing form is not set to Full Height. Under these specific conditions, the attribute will determine the number of lines to be displayed in the part, with any remaining lines available for scrolling. The part's height will be dynamically calculated based on the value of this attribute.

Meta.Aliases: Number Of Display Lines In Scroll, Num Of Display Lines In Scroll

Number Of Display Lines In Scroll.Name: Number Of Display Lines In Scroll

Object.Description: This attribute is used to associate an Object at the part level.
Object.Name: Object

ObjectEx.Description: It provides the ease of using enhanced method formula syntax while specifying the object association.
ObjectEx.Name: ObjectEx

On.Description: ON keyword is used to specify a list of Actions to be executed on the occurance of an Event.
On.Name: On

Option.Description: Option is an attribute which can be used by various definitions, to provide a conditional result in a program.
Option.Name: Option

Page Break.Description: This attribute specifies the Closing Page Line and the Opening Page Line. This attribute is used in case the number of lines to be printed exceeds the number of lines that can be fitted in the Part.
Page Break.Name: Page Break

Pre Printed.Description: This attribute works in conjunction with the preprinted / plain button in the print configuration screen. When the attribute is set to Yes, it will not print the contents of the Part on the paper assuming the stationary is pre-printed stationary.
Pre Printed.Name: Pre Printed

Pre Printed Border.Description: This attribute works in conjunction with the preprinted / plain button in the print configuration screen.  When the attribute is set to Yes will not print the border of the Part on the paper assuming the stationary is pre-printed stationary.
Pre Printed Border.Name: Pre Printed Border

Preaccept Object Map.Description: This attribute is used to call the object map before the part accept.
Preaccept Object Map.Name: Preaccept Object Map

Print BG.Description: This attribute allows the background color to be defined for the Part. The color thus applied for the Part will not be displayed on the screen but will be printed in color on the color printer and in shades of grey on the black & white printer.
Print BG.Name: Print BG

QR Code.Description: This attribute is used to generate QR Code from the text specified
QR Code.Name: QR Code

Repeat.Description: The line is repeated with respect to the collection name specified. In the repeated lines we can retreive any data we require form the collection and the same can be printed or displayed. It is also possible to repeat a line without a collection in context of variable usage.
Repeat.Name: Repeat

Retain Focus.Description: It indicates that part should retain information about the line which is currently in focus even if the focus is moved to other part.
Retain Focus.Name: Retain Focus

Scroll.Description: This attribute has to be specified if a line or field that is repeated with respect to a collection. If this attribute is set to No (default value), all the lines that are displayed will be shrunk into the part and may be illegible to view.
Scroll.Name: Scroll

Scroll Indicator Style.Description: This attribute is used to set the style of the scroll indicator in the part. It will be applicable only when vertical scrolling is enabled within the part.
Scroll Indicator Style.Name: Scroll Indicator Style

Select.Description: It indicates that the lines owned by this Part are selectable or not and the default value for the same is Yes.
Select.Name: Select

Set.Description: This attribute sets number of lines to be displayed in the part.
Set.Name: Set

Set Always.Description: This attribute sets the values defined in the fields of the Part dynamically.  whenever any changes take place in the values of the fields which are dependent on the fields in the part, they are always modified.
Set Always.Name: Set Always

Shorten Y Axis Label.Description: This attribute is used to shorten the y-axis labels and provide a legend in case the values are above thresholds, such as showing in thousands, if the value is above 999. Its default value is set to FALSE.
Shorten Y Axis Label.Name: Shorten Y Axis Label

Space Bottom.Description: This attribute helps to specify the bottom space that a part should have.
Space Bottom.Name: Space Bottom

Space Left.Description: This attribute helps to specify the left space that a part should have.
Space Left.Name: Space Left

Space Right.Description: This attribute helps to specify the right space that a part should have.
Space Right.Name: Space Right

Space Top.Description: This attribute helps to specify the top space that a part should have.
Space Top.Name: Space Top

Stripe.Description: This attribute enables (Yes) /disables (No) Stripes for the Part to improve readability. By default it'll be set as Yes and specific format of data will have Stripes enabled. The behavior can be overridden by usage of same attribute in the children (Part, Line).
Stripe.Name: Stripe

Switch.Description: 'Switch' attribute is similar to the Option attribute but reduces code complexity and improves the performance. The Switch are grouped using a label Once a condition is satisfied from one group, switch won't  check further conditions from the same group.  It will evaluate the conditions from the other groups specified, if any.
Switch.Name: Switch

Sync.Description: This attribute determines synchronization of horizontal or vertical Parts of the Part. Default value of this attribute is NO.
Sync.Name: Sync

Use.Description: The USE keyword is used in a definition to reuse an existing definition.
Use.Name: Use

Vertical.Description: This attribute determines whether the Parts defined under the Part needs to be aligned Vertical or Horizontal. If the attribute value is set to yes then the parts are vertically aligned else they are horizontally aligned.
Vertical.Name: Vertical

Vertical Align.Description: This attribute specifies the vertical alignment of the part.

Parameters.Keywords: Bottom, Center, Centre, Justified, Left, Prompt, Right, Top

Vertical Align.Name: Vertical Align

Width.Description: The attribute specifies total width of the Part. This can be specified in percentages of the page or in mms.
Width.Name: Width

X Axis Label Word Wrap.Description: This attribute is used to specify whether the x-axis label text in the graph should undergo word/text wrapping.
X Axis Label Word Wrap.Name: X Axis Label Word Wrap

XMLAttr.Description: Specifies the Attribute and attribute value for the xml tag.
XMLAttr.Name: XMLAttr
